com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.util

Class AbstractSearchReplaceWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Writer
      • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.util.AbstractSearchReplaceWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, Appendable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TemplateWriter, VelocityWriter

    public abstract class AbstractSearchReplaceWriter
extends Writer

    AbstractSearchReplaceWriter is a writer extension that allows programmatic replacement of strings contained in written stream. For efficiency, it uses a buffer that is twice the size of the longest search string.

    Data is only written to the underlying writer when the buffer is filled, or when the writer is closed; calling flush() only flushes the underlying writer. Calling close() may not close the underlying writer, depending on the return value of closeBackingOnClose()

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Yiannis Paschalidis

      • closeBackingOnClose

        protected boolean closeBackingOnClose()
        Indicates whether the backing writer should be closed on close of this writer. Subclasses can override this to keep the underlying writer open.
        Returns:
        true if the backing writer should be closed when close() is called.

      • doReplace

        protected abstract void doReplace(String search,
             Writer backing)
                           throws IOException
        Subclasses must implement this method to perform the actual replacement.
        Parameters:
        search - the search string that was matched.
        backing - the underlying writer to write the output to.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error writing to the underlying writer.
